On May 1, 2025, Varun Beverages Ltd (VBL) provided several updates on its performance and strategic initiatives. The company reported robust financial results for the first quarter of the calendar year 2025, with a significant increase in consolidated net profit and revenue from operations . An interim dividend of ₹0.50 per share for FY25 was also declared, with a record date of May 9, 2025.

VBL announced the start of commercial production at a new facility in Buxar, Bihar, as part of its plans to commission additional greenfield plants in India. The company also established backward integration facilities in Prayagraj and DRC.

Internationally, VBL completed the acquisition of The Beverage Company (BevCo) in South Africa. The company also began distributing PepsiCo's snack products in Zimbabwe and Zambia. A subsidiary, Varun Beverages Morocco SA, entered into an agreement to manufacture and package Cheetos in Morocco, with operations expected to start around May 1, 2025.

CRISIL upgraded VBL's long-term credit rating for bank loan facilities. Following the Q1 results, VBL shares saw a slight decrease on May 2nd, but analysts maintained a positive outlook with "Buy" ratings and target prices between ₹625 and ₹665, citing potential for continued earnings growth from expansion and increased market penetration.
